author: Amira EL MASAITI
title: Measles death toll reaches nine in northern Morocco as cases continue to rise
text:
Reported cases of measles have been rising steadily for the past three months in northern Morocco, raising serious concerns among healthcare professionals and families.
The surge in infections has become an alarming threat to children, particularly in the Tanger-T√©touan-Al Hoce√Øma region, where the number of cases has risen to nine.
Of these, five fatalities occurred at the Mohammed VI University Hospital in Tanger, all involving residents of the Tanger province. Additionally, three deaths were reported in Chefchaouen, and one in T√©touan.
As of this year, 448 severe cases of measles have required medical attention, underscoring the severity of the ongoing health crisis.
The numbers are particularly alarming in the past three months. In October, 115 cases were reported; in November, 113; and in December, 104. This constant increase is expected to continue in the coming days, putting further pressure on the healthcare system.
The outbreak has spread beyond the major cities, with provinces such as Chefchaouen seeing hundreds of child infections.
In response, public health authorities have launched campaigns to raise awareness and encourage families to vaccinate children who remain unprotected against this potentially deadly disease.
While no deaths have been recorded in Larache, Ouezzane, and M‚Äôdiq-Fnideq, several cases of measles have been reported there as well.
The Ministry of Health had previously initiated a national catch-up vaccination campaign, but the current situation highlights the need for renewed efforts.

author: Ximena Ochoa
title: Promesa del futbol chileno femenil se desmaya en entrenamiento y queda en coma
text:
Promesa del futbol chileno femenil se desmaya en entrenamiento y queda en coma La futbolista chilena Natsumy Millones, de 18 a√±os, est√° en coma inducido tras convulsionar en un entrenamiento. Su estado sigue bajo evaluaci√≥n m√©dica. 20 febrero 2025 17:07hrs 2 minutos de lectura. Compartir: Compartir Facebook X Whatsapp Telegram Copiar Enlace Enlace Copiado URL Escrito por: Ximena Ochoa X/@CSDColoColo
La joven futbolista chilena Natsumy Millones, de 18 a√±os, se encuentra en coma inducido tras sufrir un colaps o durante un entrenamiento con su club, Coquimbo Unido .
El incidente ocurri√≥ el mi√©rcoles 19 de febrero en el Complejo Deportivo Las Rozas, donde Millones se desplom√≥ y experiment√≥ convulsiones , siendo trasladada de inmediato al Hospital San Pablo de Coquimbo , a 460 kil√≥metros de Santiago, capital de Chile .
¬°Fuerza Natsumy!
Natsumy Millones, Seleccionada Nacional Juvenil y jugadora de @coquimbounidooficial, se encuentra en un delicado estado de salud, por lo que desde la familia de #LaRoja le mandamos mucha fuerza y entereza tanto para ella como para sus cercanos üôå
¬°Todos la‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/4MN9fETBZr
‚Äî Selecci√≥n Chilena (@LaRoja) February 20, 2025 adn40 Siempre Conmigo . Suscr√≠bete a nuestro canal de WhatsApp y lleva la informaci√≥n en la palma de tu mano.
Actualmente, permanece bajo sedaci√≥n y con ventilaci√≥n mec√°nica , seg√∫n inform√≥ el club en un comunicado oficial.
¬øQui√©n es Natsumy Millones? Millones, considerada una de las promesas del futbol femenino chileno , ya hab√≠a enfrentado una situaci√≥n similar durante el torneo Sudamericano Sub-17 en Paraguay el a√±o pasado, cuando se desvaneci√≥ en pleno partido y fue retirada en ambulancia.
La joven inici√≥ su carrera en Coquimbo Unido a los 12 a√±os , debutando profesionalmente en 2021. En 2022, fue pieza clave para el ascenso del equipo a la Primera Divisi√≥n , anotando dos goles en la semifinal contra Deportes Temuco.
El 8 de marzo de 2023, se convirti√≥ en la primera futbolista de Coquimbo Unido en f irmar un contrato profesional , marcando un hito en la historia del club.
A nivel internacional, Millones represent√≥ a Chile en el Mundial Sub-17 de 2022 en India y en el Sudamericano Sub-17 de 2024 en Paraguay . Su talento y dedicaci√≥n la han posicionado como una figura destacada en el f√∫tbol femenino nacional.
Seg√∫n reportes de la prensa chilena, la delantera padece una condici√≥n neurol√≥gica preexistente para la cual estaba medicada y a la espera de una cirug√≠a, aunque contaba con autorizaci√≥n m√©dica para realizar actividad f√≠sica .
Tambi√©n te puede interesar: Rebeca Bernal se despide de Rayadas y este ser√° su nuevo destino
Tras conseguir el bicampeonato con las Rayadas, Bernal tiene un nuevo destino y una nueva liga; conoce a d√≥nde jugar√° la capitana de la Selecci√≥n Mexicana.
adn Deportes Ver nota
El estado de salud de la jugadora causa conmoci√≥n en el mundo del futbol femenil El estado de salud de Natsumy ha generado una ola de apoyo en el mundo deportivo . La selecci√≥n chilena expres√≥ en sus redes sociales: ‚ÄúDesde la familia de la Roja le mandamos mucha fuerza y entereza tanto para ella como para sus cercanos. ¬°Toda la familia del f√∫tbol est√° contigo, Natsumy!‚Äù.
Adem√°s, Coquimbo Unido ha convocado a una cadena de oraci√≥n diaria a las 21:00 horas (tiempo local) para enviar energ√≠as positivas a la jugadora durante su recuperaci√≥n.
Actual estado de salud de Natsumy Millones El m√©dico jefe de la Unidad de Paciente Cr√≠tico Adulto del Hospital San Pablo, H√©ctor Ugarte , inform√≥ que Millones lleg√≥ con un cuadro convulsivo que oblig√≥ a los especialistas a inducirle el coma y conectarla a un ventilador mec√°nico.
üî¥ Natsumy Millones, permanece en estado cr√≠tico tras desplomarse durante un entrenamiento.
üó£Ô∏è Seg√∫n inform√≥ el doctor H√©ctor Ugarte, la joven ingres√≥ hace 3 d√≠as con un cuadro convulsivo que oblig√≥ a los especialistas a sedarla y conectarla a ventilaci√≥n mec√°nica. pic.twitter.com/Uurw6zrl5p
‚Äî Diario El D√≠a (@eldia_cl) February 20, 2025 Se espera que en los pr√≥ximos d√≠as se realicen ex√°menes para evaluar la posibilidad de retirarle la sedaci√≥n y el soporte ventilatorio.
adn40 Siempre Conmigo . Suscr√≠bete a nuestro canal de Telegram y lleva la informaci√≥n en tus manos.

author: VNExplorer
title: New Hampshire GOP chairman claims Nikki Haley can win Republican primary in Granite State
text:
Former South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley can ‚Äúabsolutely‚Äù win the New Hampshire Republican presidential primary, Granite State GOP Chairman Chris Ager declared Friday.
Haley is currently running in second place in New Hampshire, according to a RealClearPolitics average of polls, with 24.8% support, which puts her 21.5 percentage points behind former President Donald Trump with less than 4 weeks to go before the Jan. 23 first-in-the-nation primary.
‚ÄúExpect the unexpected,‚Äù Ager told ‚ÄúCats & Cosby Show‚Äù host John Catsimatidis.
‚ÄúYou just don‚Äôt know what‚Äôs going to happen. The polling ‚Ä¶ over the past 6, 8 months has been that President Trump is in pretty good shape. But Nikki Haley has been making a surge,‚Äù he added.
‚ÄúI would say that Nikki Haley absolutely has the potential to win the New Hampshire primary,‚Äù Ager said. ‚ÄúIt‚Äôs absolutely possible. She‚Äôs been here very frequently, and every time she comes, she does a town hall, and she takes questions from the audience unscripted, anybody.‚Äù
Polls show Haley running in second, behind former President Donald Trump, in the New Hampshire race. AFP via Getty Images
New Hampshire‚Äôs GOP chairman said Friday that Haley can ‚Äúabsolutely‚Äù win the first-in-the-nation primary. REUTERS
The tactic, however, carries its risks, as Haley learned earlier this week when she faced criticism after answering a question at a Berlin, NH, town hall about the cause of the Civil War.
In her answer, Haley failed to mention slavery as one of the reasons. The following day she clarified, ‚ÄúOf course the Civil War was about slavery.‚Äù
She also accused the Biden campaign and the Democratic Party of sending a ‚Äúplant‚Äù to pose the Civil War question to sabotage her event.
Ager noted that there are two upcoming debates that will take place in New Hampshire ‚Äì one on Jan. 18 hosted by ABC News and WMUR-TV and another on Jan. 21 that will air on CNN ‚Äì and with same-day voting, if ‚Äúsomebody catches fire, this is the place they can do that.‚Äù
Haley secured the endorsement of popular Republican New Hampshire Gov. Chris Sununu earlier this month, boosting her chances in the upcoming contest.
The former United Nations ambassador drew a crowd of more than 300 people Friday at her final event of the year in the Granite State before heading to Iowa for more campaigning ahead of the Hawkeye State‚Äôs Jan. 15 caucus.

title: HHS to cut 10,000 jobs, 'streamline' operations

author: CNN Newsource
title: With war raging in Gaza, Christmas is effectively cancelled in Bethlehem
text:
With war raging in Gaza, Christmas is effectively cancelled in Bethlehem
By Will Ripley, Mohammed Tawfeeq and Abeer Salman, CNN
Bethlehem, West Bank (CNN) ‚Äî Church bells echo through the labyrinth-like streets of Bethlehem. With Christmas approaching, the city in the Israeli-occupied West Bank should be teeming with visitors. But this year, it is almost deserted.
Local leaders made the decision last month to scale back festivities in solidarity with the Palestinian population, as heavy fighting raged between Israel and Hamas in the devastated Gaza Strip.
More than 20,000 Palestinians have been killed during Israel‚Äôs air and ground offensive, according to the Hamas-controlled Ministry of Health in Gaza and nearly 85% of the strip‚Äôs total population has been displaced.
The war was sparked by Hamas‚Äô terror attack on October 7 on southern Israel in which at least 1,200 people were killed and more than 240 others taken hostage.
Many here have ties to Gaza through loved ones and friends, and a sense of misery has fallen upon the city revered by Christians as the birthplace of Jesus Christ.
Decorations that once adorned neighborhoods have been removed. The parades and religious celebrations have been canceled. In the city center, the traditional enormous Christmas tree of Manger Square is conspicuously absent.
Traveling into Bethlehem, about eight kilometers south of Jerusalem, isn‚Äôt ordinarily an easy journey. The Israeli-built West Bank barrier restricts movement, as do the various checkpoints leading in and out of the city. It‚Äôs only got worse since Hamas‚Äô brazen attack
.
Since October 7, Israel has restricted movement in Bethlehem and other Palestinian towns in the West Bank, with military checkpoints allowing access in and out, impacting Palestinians trying to get to work.
The occupied territory has also experienced a surge in violence, with at least 300 Palestinians killed in Israeli attacks, according to the Palestinian health ministry.
‚ÄúMy son asked me why there‚Äôs no Christmas tree this year, I don‚Äôt know how to explain it,‚Äù Ali Thabet tells CNN.
He and his family live in Al Shawawra, a Palestinian village near Bethlehem, and visit each Christmas ‚Äúbecause our relationship with our Christian brothers is a strong relationship
He and his family live in Bethlehem and visit each Christmas ‚Äúbecause our relationship with our Christian brothers is a strong relationship.‚Äù
He explains: ‚ÄúWe join them in their celebrations, and they also join us in our celebrations. But this year‚Äôs holiday season is very bad.‚Äù
Walking down the cobble-stone streets, the impact of the conflict is evident.
Businesses were banking on a busy festive period after suffering through the hardships and travel restrictions of the coronavirus pandemic. But without the usual crowds of tourists and the faithful, many of the hotels, shops and restaurants have shuttered.
Bethlehem‚Äôs economy depends on pilgrims and tourism, explains third-generation shop owner Rony Tabash, who stands outside his store waiting for customers who will never arrive.
Souvenirs and intricately carved olive wood carvings of the nativity scene sit on shelves gathering dust. Tabash‚Äôs store is one of the handful to remain open, out of a wish to support the skilled artisans that delicately make his merchandise.
Tabash brings his father with him to the shop each day to get him out of the house. His grandfather opened the store back in 1927 and this place, along with the square and its famous church, have become ‚Äúpart of our heart.‚Äù
‚ÄúWe‚Äôve never seen Christmas like this,‚Äù he continues. ‚ÄúSince three months, honestly, we don‚Äôt have one sale. I don‚Äôt want to keep my father at home. I don‚Äôt want to give up hope.‚Äù
Even the
Church of the Nativity ‚Äì which became the first World Heritage site in the Palestinian territories in 2012 ‚Äì is largely empty. In a normal year, queues of hundreds would snake around the car park outside with pilgrims patiently waiting to enter its grotto, considered since the 2nd Century to be the exact location of Christ‚Äôs birth. A 14-pointed silver star set into the marble floor marks the precise spot where Jesus is said to have been born.
In the 4th Century, Emperor Constantine
founded a church on the site, which was destroyed in the year 529, only to be replaced by larger structures, which form the basis of the church today.
Inside, it would usually be standing room only. But this year, the fighting in Gaza has changed everything. Now, you can practically hear a pin drop.
‚ÄúI have never seen it like this,‚Äù says Father Spiridon Sammour, a Greek Orthodox priest at the Church of the Nativity.
‚ÄúChristmas is joy, love and peace. We have no peace. We have no joy,‚Äù he says solemnly. ‚ÄúIt is out of our hands, and we pray for the leaders who will make the decisions [all] over the world to God to help them, give them his light to make peace here and all over the world.
CNN‚Äôs Kareem El Damanhoury, Eyad Kourdi and Sugam Pokharel contributed to this report.
The-CNN-Wire
‚Ñ¢ & ¬© 2023 Cable News Network, Inc., a Warner Bros. Discovery Company. All rights reserved.

author: EP
title: Un ataque armado en Nixeria deixa polo menos trece mortos - Faro de Vigo
text: Al menos trece personas han muerto en un ataque perpetrado por parte de hombres armados en la comunidad Anguwan Mai-Giro, que se encuentra entre las localidades de Rafi y Shiro, en el estado nigeriano de N√≠ger, en el centro del pa√≠s africano. El ataque, que tuvo lugar el mi√©rcoles por la noche, ha sido condenado por el gobernador en funciones de N√≠ger, Yajubu Garba, quien ha descrito los hechos como \"sat√°nicos, insensibles y atroces\". \"Es muy desalentador y perturbador que otros seres humanos lleven a cabo un acto tan b√°rbaro y cruel\", reza un comunicado. El gobernador ha reafirmado \"la determinaci√≥n y compromiso inquebrantables\" de \"controlar la ola de inseguridad en el Estado\", mientras que ha alentado a las fuerzas de seguridad a \"no desanimarse por los ataques a las comunidades\", asegur√°ndoles \"todo el apoyo\". El noreste de Nigeria es el epicentro de las actividades de Boko Haram y su escisi√≥n, Estado Isl√°mico en √Åfrica Occidental (ISWA), si bien la inseguridad se ha extendido a otras zonas del centro, el norte y el noroeste, haciendo saltar las alarmas sobre la posible expansi√≥n de estas redes terroristas y criminales.

author: Delay
title: La familia de Aurora Picornell denuncia a Le Senne por un delito de odio por desgarrar su retrato en el Parlament
text:
Portada
mis comunidades
otras secciones
‚ÄúPod√©is matar a hombres, a mujeres, a ni√±os como el m√≠o que todav√≠a no han nacido. ¬øPero, y las ideas? ¬øCon qu√© balas matar√©is las ideas?‚Äù. El imaginario colectivo atribuye esta frase a la activista Aurora Picornell, asesinada por el franquismo en la noche de reyes de 1937. Antes de abandonar la c√°rcel con los falangistas que la detuvieron, dicen que la joven se despidi√≥ de sus compa√±eras de celda, llevando con ella una bobina de hilo que prometi√≥ hacerles llegar si sobreviv√≠a. Despu√©s de ser torturada, fue fusilada y enterrada en una fosa com√∫n. La bobina nunca regres√≥. Su nombre ha vuelto a estar de actualidad este martes despu√©s de que el presidente del Parlament balear, Gabriel Le Senne, de Vox, haya roto su imagen en un pleno de la c√°mara auton√≥mica.
.
Una persona valiente que luch√≥ contra la dictadura , por una Espa√±a libre y con derechos para todos los ciudadanos algo que les viene muy grande a los que a√±oran el franquismo.
[#1](c1#c-1) ostia eso de las balas me ha recordado a la canci√≥n "Fosa com√∫n"
No eran m√°rtires ni h√©roes, solo fueron a luchar
Con la rabia de los pobres, contra el fascismo brutal
Pelearon contra los caciques y la prepotencia militar
Y dieron la vida por simple dignidad
Los matones se re√≠an y el cabr√≥n del cura los bendec√≠a
Mientras los mataban en nombre de su dios
Cara al sol de madrugada con una camisa azul
Los tiraron como a perros en una fosa com√∫n
El silencio de los muertos grita libertad
Los mataron de un tiro en la nuca o fusilados contra la pared
Los eliminaron con sa√±a criminal
Los matones se re√≠an y el cabr√≥n del cura los bendec√≠a
Mientras los mataban en nombre de su dios
Aquellos que apretaron el gatillo no debieran olvidar
Que aquellas balas no mataron todo, nadie mata a la verdad
En una cuneta, entre calaveras agujereadas, naci√≥ la democracia
Cara al sol de madrugada con una camisa azul
Los tiraron como a perros en una fosa com√∫n
El silencio de los muertos grita libertad
La herida sigue abierta
Sigue abierta, sigue abierta, sigue abierta

author: Joshua Bartholomew
title: Is the Pixel Tablet Destined for Google‚Äôs Graveyard of Abandoned Projects?
text:
The tech world was abuzz with excitement when Google finally re-entered the tablet market with the Pixel Tablet in 2023. But recent whispers suggest that Google‚Äôs commitment to the tablet might be wavering. Reports indicate that while a second-generation Pixel Tablet is in the works, Google may be pulling the plug on the project thereafter. Could the Pixel Tablet be heading towards the infamous Google graveyard, alongside products like Google Glass and Google+?
What‚Äôs happening? Sources suggest that internal discussions at Google point towards the discontinuation of the Pixel Tablet line after the release of the second-generation model, tentatively slated for a 2025 launch. This news comes as a surprise to many, especially considering the relatively recent launch of the first Pixel Tablet.
Why is Google abandoning the Pixel Tablet? While Google hasn‚Äôt officially confirmed these reports, several factors could be contributing to this decision:
Fierce competition: The tablet market is dominated by Apple‚Äôs iPad, with strong contenders from Samsung and other Android manufacturers. Breaking into this established market and achieving significant market share is a challenging feat. Shifting priorities: Google‚Äôs focus seems to be shifting towards AI and its integration across various platforms. This might mean diverting resources away from hardware projects like the Pixel Tablet. Unclear market positioning: The Pixel Tablet, with its dock and smart home features, attempts to be both a tablet and a smart display. This somewhat confusing positioning might not have resonated with consumers. My experience with the Pixel Tablet Personally, I found the Pixel Tablet to be a decent device with a clean Android experience and good integration with other Google services. The speaker dock is a unique feature that adds value, transforming the tablet into a smart home hub. However, I also felt that the tablet lacked a distinct identity and struggled to compete with the versatility and app ecosystem of the iPad.
What does this mean for the future of Android tablets? Google‚Äôs potential exit from the tablet market raises questions about the future of Android tablets in general. While Samsung and other manufacturers continue to produce Android tablets, Google‚Äôs departure could signal a lack of confidence in the platform‚Äôs ability to compete with Apple‚Äôs iPadOS. This could lead to less investment and innovation in the Android tablet space.
What‚Äôs next? While the second-generation Pixel Tablet is expected to launch in 2025, it remains to be seen whether Google can address the shortcomings of the first generation and carve out a niche for itself in the competitive tablet market. If not, the Pixel Tablet might become another casualty in Google‚Äôs long list of abandoned projects.
Delving Deeper into the Possible Reasons for Discontinuation To understand why Google might abandon the Pixel Tablet, it‚Äôs crucial to examine the broader context of the tablet market and Google‚Äôs own history with hardware products.
The iPad‚Äôs dominance: Apple‚Äôs iPad has consistently held the lion‚Äôs share of the tablet market. Its success can be attributed to factors like a robust app ecosystem optimized for tablets, a seamless user experience, and strong brand loyalty. Android tablets, on the other hand, have often struggled to provide a comparable experience. Google‚Äôs track record: Google has a history of experimenting with various hardware products, but not all of them have been successful. Products like Google Glass, Google+, and Nexus Q were ambitious but ultimately failed to gain traction in the market. This pattern raises concerns about Google‚Äôs commitment to seeing its hardware projects through. Cannibalization concerns: Google also offers the Pixel Fold, a foldable phone that can function as a tablet. The existence of the Pixel Fold might lead to internal competition and cannibalization of the Pixel Tablet‚Äôs market share. The Potential Impact on Consumers If Google discontinues the Pixel Tablet, it could have several implications for consumers:
Limited choices: Consumers interested in Android tablets will have fewer options to choose from, especially those looking for a premium tablet experience with tight integration with Google services. Reduced innovation: Google‚Äôs exit could lead to less innovation in the Android tablet space, as other manufacturers might be less inclined to invest heavily in a platform with uncertain prospects. Software updates: Existing Pixel Tablet users might be concerned about the longevity of software updates and support if Google abandons the product line. Despite the discouraging news, it‚Äôs important to Pixel Tablet that Google hasn‚Äôt officially confirmed the discontinuation of the Pixel Tablet. The second-generation model could still surprise us with significant improvements and a more compelling value proposition. However, if the rumors are true, it will be another reminder of the challenges of competing in the cutthroat world of consumer electronics, even for a giant like Google.
